desc: EZH1, an epigenetic modifier, is altered by mutation or amplification in various tumors.
gene/name: enhancer of zeste 1 polycomb repressive complex 2 subunit

desc: EZH1 is the catalytic component of the Polycomb repressive complex 2 (PRC2) which methylates histone H3 at lysine 27 (H3K27), resulting in chromatin compaction and target gene repression. Compared to its homolog, EZH2, EZH1-containing PRC2 complexes show weaker methylation activity, target fewer genes, and are more abundant in non-proliferative adult organs (PMID: 19026781). EZH1 plays a role in maintaining embryonic stem cell pluripotency (PMID: 19026780). EZH1 is not commonly altered in cancer, but recurrent mutations in EZH1 are often the second hit in autonomous thyroid adenomas (PMID: 27500488). Dual EZH1/2 inhibitors are being tested preclinically in several cancers (PMID: 24183969, 25395428).
gene/name: enhancer of zeste 1 polycomb repressive complex 2 subunit
articles/0/title: Recurrent EZH1 mutations are a second hit in autonomous thyroid adenomas.
articles/1/title: Ezh1 and Ezh2 maintain repressive chromatin through different mechanisms.
articles/2/title: EZH1 mediates methylation on histone H3 lysine 27 and complements EZH2 in maintaining stem cell identity and executing pluripotency.
articles/3/title: Selective inhibition of EZH2 and EZH1 enzymatic activity by a small molecule suppresses MLL-rearranged leukemia.
articles/4/title: Identification of EZH2 and EZH1 small molecule inhibitors with selective impact on diffuse large B cell lymphoma cell growth.
